item.title: Ohio Natural Health
item.description:
Ohio Natural Health

Naturopathic, Acupuncture, and Traditional Chinese Medicine provider serving the greater Cleveland Ohio area

item.title: Ask Well: The Downside of Smoothies
item.description:
Ask Well: The Downside of Smoothies

Do I absorb more sugar and calories when I drink fruits and vegetables in a smoothie as opposed to just eating them whole? Answer: It's very likely that you are getting more calories and sugar when you drink a smoothie than when eating whole fruits or vegetables, said Sarah B.

item.title: The Changing American Diet
item.description:
The Changing American Diet

See what we ate on an average day, for the past several decades. After seeing the Open Data Institute's project on the changing British Diet, I couldn't help but wonder how the American diet has changed over the years. The United States Department of Agriculture keeps track of these sort of things through the Food Availability Data System.

item.title: 36 Pictures To See Which Muscle You're Stretching
item.description:
36 Pictures To See Which Muscle You're Stretching

Whether you're a chronic sitter, a daily exerciser, or a weekend warrior, you probably know stretching is a critical habit. By sending blood flow to your muscles and helping your joints move through their full range of motion, stretching improves your posture and athletic performance while lowering your risk of pain and injury.

item.title: Chair yoga gives seniors' health a lift
item.description:
Chair yoga gives seniors' health a lift

DALLAS -- A yoga class is the last place Ronnie Weiss would expect you to find him. "I started out just driving my wife here and always thought of yoga as a lightweight, feminine-type thing," said Weiss, 85. After problems with his hands, feet, and hips, Weiss gave it a shot.

item.title: 'Good fat,' low cholesterol, may actually be bad for you
item.description:
'Good fat,' low cholesterol, may actually be bad for you

Just about every diet recommends reducing saturated fats, such as butter and cheese, and replacing them with unsaturated fats, such as vegetable oil and fatty fish. The 2015 dietary guidelines advise limiting saturated fats to no more than 10% of daily calories.

item.title: Beyond 'Namaste': The benefits of yoga in schools
item.description:
Beyond 'Namaste': The benefits of yoga in schools

Most recently, the issue was raised by parents in Georgia whose children attend an elementary school that implemented yoga in the classroom. Although yoga is not a religion in and of itself, it is a philosophy, rooted in Hinduism, composed of a system of various practices designed to heighten spirituality.

item.title: The art of acupuncture in photography
item.description:
The art of acupuncture in photography

What happens when a photographer combines creative forces with a licensed acupuncturist? When medical procedures have long been displayed primarily in just clinical forms of photography, rather than artistic, would it be possible to visually show the peaceful nature and energy flow of the healing art of acupuncture?

item.title: The health hazards of sitting
item.description:
The health hazards of sitting

We know sitting too much is bad, and most of us intuitively feel a little guilty after a long TV binge. But what exactly goes wrong in our bodies when we park ourselves for nearly eight hours per day, the average for a U.S. adult?

item.title: Topical Use of Castor Oil
item.description:
Topical Use of Castor Oil

Todd A. Born, ND For many centuries, folklore medicine has recommended the use of castor oil, either orally or transdermally, for a wide range of complaints. Naturopathic doctors and other practitioners continue to utilize its therapeutic potential in the management of the health of their patients and clients.
